descriptionSet.description: On this advertisement calendar from 1942, we see Lord Krishna sprinkling color on an Indian woman wearing red sari. In the background, some clouds and a forest can be seen. A peacock is depicted in front of Krishna. On the sides of the image, detailed s tell the customer how he will be able to individually design the blank spaces in the advertisement.

inscription.text: This is a Specimen (Item No. 8 & 16) of a Complete 10'' X 15'' Size Calendar With Tinted Ground Advertisement And Monthly Date Pad No. 3 If This Tinted Ground Not Wanted the Consult for Prices with Item No. 8 only
The Blank Paces On Both Sides Of The Picture And Date Pads Are Available For Printing Customer's Advertisement In Any Language --- Consult For Prices With Item No. 8 and No. 16 Of Our Price List

This Picture Is Also Available in 15'' x 11'' Ins. or 20'' x 15'' Ins. --- If Customers Require Monthly Date Pads No. 2 Instead Of Date Pads No. 3 Then Add The Difference Prices Between Item No. 3 and No. 6 Of Our Price List

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

rights.text: Copyrighted. Copyright with the original artists and publishers.

titleSet.title: Na Maro Pichkari (Don't sprinkle coloured water on me) in a 1942 calender advertisement.

description-en: On this advertisement calendar from 1942, we see Lord Krishna sprinkling color on an Indian woman wearing red sari. In the background, some clouds and a forest can be seen. A peacock is depicted in front of Krishna. On the sides of the image, detailed descriptions tell the customer how he will be able to individually design the blank spaces in the advertisement. (gs)
